issue.title: Sharing a point of interest
issue.body:
**Original author :** Magoni Bruno

There is some need about sharing a point of interest located into an easySDI MAP.

This new feature should allow any user to define a point of interest (OpenLayers marker into the MAP) et to submit it to another user through a link (similar to Google Maps sharing map functionality).

A new MAP tool should be developed.
When activated into a MAP context, a button will allow user to activate such process:
* the user locate a marker into the map where he wants
* when marker is positioned, a popup appears which allow users to copy-paste the shared URL
* the popup must be clsed by the user
* previous marker is automatically deleted when the user wants to mark another point of interest or select another MAP tool

The shared URL contains such parameters:
* easySDI context identifier of the current map
* layers currently displayed (notice that added layers won't be stored)
* current geographical extent
* coordinates of the point of interest (marker)

When opening a shared URL, layers depends always of the easySDI right access.
The marker will be displayed with the same geographical extent that the current one when positionning the point of interest.
